channel.title: Character Animation
channel.description:
First off I would like to say that I have no intention of pissing off the members here. I've read previous threads in this section and they're flamed repeatedly with no remorse. I will not lie to you, I'm a shit programmer, I am a noob. With that being said I present my question;
Recently I've been working on a 317 source. I suddenly realized something that I hated: when my character stands still, he rocks back and forth. I'm used to them standing at a statue like position. I was wondering if anyone could inform me on how I could remove this.

item.title: Character Animation
item.dc:creator: @Docent Limits
item.description:
@Docent wrote:

Hold up, there has never been a statue stand animation, I always remembered the players torso moving up and down slowly and his/her head move to the right a bit every loop.

Otherwise, like they said check configurations, the java files that contain walking and such.

Read full topic

item.title: Character Animation
item.dc:creator: @TF4LY TF4LY
item.description:
@TF4LY wrote:

Sorry, my base is Project Insanity. And I’m just messing around with a source and client locally.

Read full topic

item.title: Character Animation
item.dc:creator: @Dan0194 Dan0194
item.description:
@Dan0194 wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:3, topic:539114”][quote author=DAn0194 link=topic=657950.msg4401105#msg4401105 date=1390673897]
defiantly client sided check it out over there. btw if your a shit programmer try to learn some java before going into making your own server.
[/quote]
This is set server sided as well. I mean, I don’t know if you know this. But most servers have set stand/walk/run/etc anims…

OP: Can you at least tell us the base you’re using?[/quote]
I know but his stand anim that is in his client sided probably has to be changed.

Read full topic
